title: Main Shaft, Disassemble and Reassemble

steps.text: Remove main shaft - see operation "Main Shaft, Remove and Install"
Press 4th gear (4) from main shaft using KM-6220 (1), KM-6223-1 (2), and KM-6223-2 (3)
Press 3rd gear (4) from main shaft (5) using KM-6220 (1), KM-6223-1 (2), and KM-6224 (3)
Check wearing parts for damage and replace as necessary
Remove 5th gear (2) and 5th gear synchroniser ring (1) from main shaft (3)
Remove 2x needle roller bearing (4, 5) from bushing
Check wearing parts for damage and replace as necessary Note: Ball (1), slider (2) are under spring tension. When removing shift sleeve (4), ensure that ball, slider, and spring (3) are not lost

Press reverse gear (6) with pressure comb (8), needle roller bearing (7), reverse synchroniser ring (5), synchromesh body for 5th-/reverse gear (4) and bushing (3) from main shaft (9) using KM-6220 (1) and KM-6221 (2)
Check all parts for damage and replace damaged parts as necessary.

substeps.text: (II) Clamp main shaft in vice - use protective jaws. Slide
(III) Push slider slightly upwards. Press ball against spring

steps.text: Install pressure comb (11), reverse gear (9) and needle roller bearing (10) to main shaft (3)

substeps.text: Ensure that needle roller bearing is not damaged

steps.text: Install reverse gear synchroniser ring (8), 5th /reverse gear synchromesh body (7) and 5th gear synchroniser ring (6) on main shaft
Install 5th gear (4) and needle roller bearing (5) to main shaft

substeps.text: Ensure that needle roller bearing is not damaged

steps.text: Press 3rd gear onto main shaft using KM-514
Press 4th gear (2) onto main shaft (3) using KM-6219 (1)
Install main shaft - see operation "Main Shaft, Remove and Install"

warnings:

always replace entire main shaft assembly. Obtain appropriate
repair kits for synchroniser assembly from Aftersales
